text.section: An applicant who otherwise qualifies for a license is entitled to be examined as provided in this section.
The Commission periodically shall give examinations to applicants at the times and places that the Commission determines.
Except as provided in subsection (f)(2)(ii) of this section, the Commission shall give each qualified applicant notice of the time and place of examination.

To take an examination, an applicant shall pay:
to the Commission, an examination fee set by the Commission; and
to the Commission or a testing service chosen by the Commission, an amount covering the cost of the examination.

section.section: Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the Commission shall determine the subjects, scope, and form of and the passing score for examinations given under this subtitle.

To ensure the protection of the interests of those persons who are represented by licensed real estate brokers, the Commission shall structure the examinations for a real estate broker license to test:
the ability of an applicant to perform the services authorized by a real estate broker license; and
the knowledge of the applicant of the general practice for handling real estate transactions.

To eliminate the possibility of discrimination in the administration of the examination, each copy of an examination for a particular license given on a particular date shall contain the same questions. However, the questions may be in different order.
The Commission may use a testing service to administer the examinations under this section.

If the Commission uses a testing service under this subsection, the testing service, subject to the requirements set by the Commission, may:
set the times and places of examinations; and
give applicants notice of the examinations.
